supersolids.Animation.MatplotlibAnimation¶

Implements an Animation with matplotlib (for Systems in 1D or 2D).

Module Contents¶

Classes¶

MatplotlibAnimation

Functions¶

param resolution

number of grid points in one direction

class supersolids.Animation.MatplotlibAnimation.MatplotlibAnimation(Anim: supersolids.Animation.Animation.Animation)[source]¶

Bases: supersolids.Animation.Animation.Animation

set_limits(self, row: int, col: int, x_min: float, x_max: float, y_min: float, y_max: float)[source]¶

Sets the plot limits appropriate, even if the initial wave function \(\psi_0\) is not normalized.

Parameters

  • row – row of the subplot for the animation

  • col – column of the subplot for the animation

  • x_min – minimum x value of subplot

  • x_max – maximum x value of subplot

  • y_min – minimum y value of subplot

  • y_max – maximum y value of subplot

set_limits_smart(self, row: int, col: int, System: supersolids.Schroedinger.Schroedinger)[source]¶

Sets the plot limits appropriate, even if the initial wave function \(\psi_0\) is not normalized.

Parameters

  • row – row of the subplot for the animation

  • col – column of the subplot for the animation

  • System – Defines the Schroedinger equation for a given problem

get_V_plot_values(self, i: int, j: int, System: supersolids.Schroedinger.Schroedinger, reserve: float = 1.0)[source]¶
animate(self, frame_index: int, System: supersolids.Schroedinger.Schroedinger, accuracy: float = 10 ** - 6)[source]¶

Sets the plot limits appropriate, even if the initial wave function \(\psi_0\) is not normalized.

Parameters

  • frame_index – Current index of frame

  • System – Defines the Schroedinger equation for a given problem

  • accuracy – Convergence is reached when relative error of mu is smaller than accuracy, where \(\mu = - \log(\psi_{normed}) / (2 dt)\)

start(self, System: supersolids.Schroedinger.Schroedinger, accuracy: float = 10 ** - 6)[source]¶

Sets the plot limits appropriate, even if the initial wave function \(\psi_0\) is not normalized

Parameters

  • accuracy – Convergence is reached when relative error of mu is smaller than accuracy, where \(\mu = - \log(\psi_{normed}) / (2 dt)\)

  • System – Defines the Schroedinger equation for a given problem

supersolids.Animation.MatplotlibAnimation.plot_2d(resolution=32, x_lim: Tuple[float, float] = (- 1, 1), y_lim: Tuple[float, float] = (- 1, 1), z_lim: Tuple[float, float] = (0, 1), alpha: List[float] = [0.6], **kwargs)[source]¶
Parameters

  • resolution – number of grid points in one direction

  • x_lim – Limits of plot in x direction

  • y_lim – Limits of plot in y direction

  • z_lim – Limits of plot in z direction

  • alpha – alpha value for plot transparency
